In contexts such as anifstatement‚Äôs test where the result of the expression will already be coerced to a Boolean, casting to a Boolean via double negation (!!) or aBooleancall is unnecessary. For example, theseifstatements are equivalent:
if(!!foo){// ...}if(Boolean(foo)){// ...}if(foo){// ...}1234567891011Copy code to clipboard
content.sub_configuration_introduction:
This rule has an object option:
"enforceForInnerExpressions"when set totrue, in addition to checking default contexts, checks whether extra boolean casts are present in expressions whose result is used in a boolean context. See examples below. Default isfalse, meaning that this rule by default does not warn about extra booleans cast inside inner expressions.
Deprecated:The object propertyenforceForLogicalOperandsis deprecated (eslint#18222). Please useenforceForInnerExpressionsinstead.
